Within the sketch, draw a rectangle by creating four lines as follows: - line 1: starting from (0,0) and ending at (0.75,0) - line 2: starting from (0.75,0) and ending at (0.75,0.4322) - line 3: starting from (0.75,0.4322) and ending at (0,0.4322) - line 4: starting from (0,0.4322) and ending at (0,0) 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector provided in the coordinate system. 5. Create a new coordinate system with the provided euler angles and translation vector, relative to part 1's coordinate system's final position. 2. Generate a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Within the sketch, draw a rectangle by creating four lines as follows: - line 1: starting from (0,0) and ending at (0.6314,0) - line 2: starting from (0.6314,0) and ending at (0.6314,0.3008) - line 3: starting from (0.6314,0.3008) and ending at (0,0.3008) - line 4: starting from (0,0.3008) and ending at (0,0) 4. With the sketch still active, create a cut extrusion using the given parameters, resulting in a sloped side on the prism. For both parts, ensure the final shapes maintain their dimensions as provided in the descriptions for length, width, and height. By following these instructions, you will create a CAD model for the described assembly.</description>

Next, create the 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. This sketch has three faces: face_1, face_2, and face_3. Face_1 will be the main face of the prism, which includes the curved side. On face_1, create loop_1: loop_1 contains 4 curves: - line_1 starts at [0.0417, 0.0] and ends at [0.7083, 0.0]. - arc_1 starts at [0.7083, 0.0], has a center at [0.75, 0.0417], and ends at [0.7083, 0.0833]. - line_2 starts at [0.7083, 0.0833] and ends at [0.0417, 0.0833]. - arc_2 starts at [0.0417, 0.0833], has a center at [0.0, 0.0417], and ends at [0.0417, 0.0]. Create loop_2: loop_2 consists of a single circle (circle_1) with the center at [0.0417, 0.0417] and a radius of 0.0139. Create loop_3: loop_3 consists of a single circle (circle_1) with the center at [0.375, 0.0417] and a radius of 0.0139. For the extrusion step, extrude the 2D sketch along the normal (Z-axis) by 0.0069 units and along the opposite direction by 0.0069 units, creating a symmetric shape. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. The resulting part will have dimensions of 0.75 in length, 0.0139 in width, and 0.75 in height.</description>
